## Summary table
```{r}
library(DT)
df<-rbind(c("ozflights", "transport", "package", "Flight data"),
          c("ozroaddeaths", "transport", "package", "Road deaths"),
          c("ozvehicles", "transport", "link", "Vehicle use"),
          c("ozbeaches", "environment", "link", "Sydney beach data"),
          c("ozriver", "environment", "link", "River and rainfall data"),
          c("ozbirds", "environment", "link", "Data about Australian birds"),
          c("ozatlas", "environment", "link", "Atlas of Australian biodiversity"),
          c("ozfires", "environment", "link", "Bush fire data"),
          c("", "demographics", "link", ""),
          c("", "demographics", "link", ""),
          c("", "demographics", "link", ""),
          c("", "demographics", "link", ""),
          c("", "demographics", "link", ""),
          c("", "demographics", "link", ""),
          c("", "demographics", "link", ""),
          c("ozmaps", "maps", "package", "Maps of Australia"),
          
)

DT::datatable(df, colnames = c("Name","Topic","Package/Link","Data explanation"))

```

## Maps

The [readme file](https://github.com/mdsumner/ozmaps/) is very descriptive for how to create Maps of australia in ggplot. 

```{r, eval = FALSE}
install.packages("ozmaps")
```

```{r, eval = TRUE}
library(ozmaps)

```

## Miscellaneous 

### Ozdates

Important australian dates, like public holidays etc. The readme on [github](https://deanmarchiori.github.io/ozdates/) explains how to use. 

```{r, eval=FALSE}
devtools::install_github("deanmarchiori/ozdates")
```
